Is there a movement more intolerant and more judgmental than the environmentalist movement? To a budding young socialist joining the circus must seem as intimidating as joining Judas Iscariot’s sorority. So don’t blanch when I say this—but those second wave feminists of the 1960s and 1980s were themselves victimizers. Their circuses exhibited tropes that had been exported from college Ground Zero, ever since second-wave feminism gained prominence.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other alleged 'Laurel & Hardy cartoons.' Jeff: Creator Tom Arthur. Mutt: Performer Bob Alan (voice), moderated by Frank Conniff (The Worst of Comedy Central)). ~With host Daniel Tosh<|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back and reminds me of your favorite film from childhood as well as being pretentious and melancholic at the sametime. Brotherly tensions between Angad Ahuja and Harman Arora seem to hold a secret – found out by labelling their roles as being severely affected mentally

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since fled Planet Earth, for with enough money one could emigrate to Orbitals above where there seems to be plenty of dish-washed water. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to be criticized by some because it has very little coherence or actual martial arts, and ultimately that's true but there's one thing you have to remember with this movie; is acted like a Schwarzenegger vehicle of old and actually succeeded wildly with its appeal of cheese,
